page.title: 09VILLAGES NR.WIDEGATES
page.content: Hessenford is a small village in a valley with the river Seaton running through it.The village has a public house,The Copley Arms,a Post Office and a garage.The P.O. is in the old mill.The people are farmers and fishermen and have jobs relating to tourism. The village has a Working Mens Club,village hall,which used to be a school,a church and chapel. Widegates is a small village.It is split into two parts,the old part is over a hundred years old,the new part is an estate started about 25 years ago.Widegates has a shop with a P.O.,a garage,an antique shop a farm shop,a snooker hall and a chapel which has a hall used for coffee mornings. About half the people are retired, many have come from outside the area. There are 4or5 Bed&Breakfast places. People work on farms or in the docks.
